title: Monosodium glutamate
summary: Monosodium glutamate (MSG), also known as sodium glutamate,  is the sodium salt of glutamic acid.  MSG is found naturally in some foods including tomatoes and cheese.[2][3] MSG is used in cooking as a flavor enhancer with an umami taste that intensifies the meaty, savory flavor of food, as naturally occurring glutamate does in foods such as stews and meat soups.[4][5]
